comments.content: maybe Gravur condensed from [Lineto](http://web.archive.org/web/20131109020528/http:/www.lineto.com/) or Gravostyle from [Optimo](http://web.archive.org/web/20131109020528/http:/optimo.ch/home.php)?

Wow, beautiful typefaces!  
Particularly Gravostyle, I love it :)

Thanks a lot for your help guys

Interesting, I've been looking for a font with a "typewriter" feel. I just took a look at the Lineto and Optimo fonts and found a couple that look good, but they're too pricey.

Anyway, in my research I found one that you might want to take a look at, it's [Bryant](http://web.archive.org/web/20131109020528/http:/www.processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/bryant2/index.html) from [Process Type Foundry](http://web.archive.org/web/20131109020528/http:/www.processtypefoundry.com/).
You could also try [Isonorm](http://web.archive.org/web/20131109020528/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/isonorm/familytree.html) for a technical rounded typeface.
